thread.title: ‘In memory’ bench stolen from church park
thread.title_full: ‘In memory’ bench stolen from church park | www.kirotv.com

author: kirotv.com
title: ‘In memory’ bench stolen from church park
text:
A West Seattle church is stunned after a recent theft.
Not only was a small bench stolen from the church in the Arbor Heights neighborhood, it was also clearly marked in memory of someone's daughter.
Through their pastor, a well-known family is pleading for the person responsible to return something that never should have been taken from the church park.
"I think they were really disappointed and I think it was really sad. It's almost like taking a grave stone," said Pastor Ken Ross.
It is impossible for a thief or thieves not to know what the bench stood for.
A loving message is sprawled on the seat from heart-broken parents to their stillborn baby girl: Alexandra Ramona Kimball.
They placed a donated bench under this tree in 2008 in their place of solace: Arbor Heights Community Church on 41st Avenue Southwest.
Pastor Ken Ross guesses it was stolen last week, possibly Wednesday or Thursday.
Nothing else was taken or vandalized at Ark Park.
A-R-K for Alexandra's initials.
"For some reason somebody got it in their craw to take something that's pretty precious to the family and to the church and to the community for that matter," said Ross.
He said crime like car break-ins in the neighborhood has increased recently, but nothing like this.
The three-piece bench reads:
In Memory of Our Baby
Alexandra Ramona Kimball
Always Loved
03 - 28 - 08
The pastor’s message to the thieves: “Well I think to do the right thing,” he said. "Maybe to search the core of their heart and say: ok, what would be the right thing to do?"
The bench weighs about 200 pounds.
